text:
The <style> task does not seem to support absolute paths. When I use one, it
just prefixes the current path to it. I have specified
"/home/ernst/orion-tutorial/stylesheets/classic/classic.xsl" as the path to the
stylesheet, but when I run ant I get this error message:

bash-2.04$ ant
Buildfile: build.xml

init:

2html:
    [style] Transforming into /usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/build
    [style] Loading stylesheet /usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/src/home/ernst/o
rion-tutorial/stylesheets/classic/classic.xsl
    [style] Transforming into /usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/build
file:/usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/src/home/ernst/orion-tutorial/stylesheets/
classic/classic.xsl; Line -1; Column -1
XSL Error: Could not parse file:/usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/src/home/ernst/
orion-tutorial/stylesheets/classic/classic.xsl document!
XSL Error: SAX Exception
    [style] Failed to process /usr/home/ernst/orion-primer/src/orion-primer.
xml

BUILD FAILED

Note that /home links to /usr/home.

My build.xml file is very straightforward:

   <target name="init">
      <property name="stylesheet"
value="/home/ernst/orion-tutorial/stylesheets/classic/classic.xsl" />
   </target>

   <target name="2html" depends="init">
      <style basedir="src"
             destdir="build"
             style="${stylesheet}"
             includes="orion-primer.xml"
      />
   </target>

I ran into this problem with 1.2. I checked 1.3 beta 1 and the bug database
before committing it.
creator: ernst@jollem.com
